intro: Peripterygium quinquelobum, commonly known as the five-lobed peripterygium, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its compound leaves and small, greenish-white flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shady areas such as forest floors and stream banks. Its botanical features include a slender, branched stem and leaves with five distinct lobes, giving it its common name. It is often used in ecological restoration projects due to its ability to stabilize soil and support local wildlife.
